title.narrative: Protection monitoring and response to the new Burundian refugees in host families

description.narrative: UNHCR is providing protection services for refugees who are in out of camp situations and living in refugee settlements within the host population. The priority activity is to ensure registration and documentation of all refugees in order to avoid arbitrary arrest or detention. UNHCR will also conduct border and protection monitoring. Identification of separated and unaccompanied children will also take place so that either reunification takes place or special temporary arrangements can be organized for them. Approximately 2,000 will be supported during a four month period with CERF funds.
